issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
{html}

The guess_lexer() function in pygments doesn't seem to guess the right language in all situations. It might be best to explicitly set each code section with a "type" attribute and just pass along to pygments.lexers.get_lexer_by_name

{html}
fields.summary: APIDoc: Introduce language type for <code> sections in docgen.py

comments.body:
{html}

(from [3bc0878ebc05c0fb427eda2b157d130f20569a98]) always use the javascript lexer for now, guess_lexer seems to get it wrong most of the time. let markdown escape XML in Service doc [#2575 state:resolved]
https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile/commit/3bc0878ebc05...

{html}
